subject: Re: [junit] OutOfMemoryError
msgSnippet: If you have the JUnit running for hours on end (at times when tests are not executing) you might try Incremental Garbage Collection. The flag is -Xincgc This
messageBody:
If you have the JUnit running for hours on end (at times when tests are
not executing) you might try Incremental Garbage Collection.

The flag is

-Xincgc

This will hopefully keep objects and their references on a one to one
relationship.

I got this idea from here :
http://www.netbeans.org/articles/faqs/performance.html#FAQ_7

Big Mike


Frank Enos wrote:
>
> Hi all.
>
> I'm wondering if anyone might have a strong opinion about the likely cause
> of a java.lang.OutOfMemoryError in the awt version of the UI.
>
> It's happened a few times after I've had JUnit up and running for hours at
> a time.
>
> I'm wondering if anyone's experience might point toward memory leaks in the
> code being tested, (I know, "this is Java...") leaks in the tests,
> over-taxed JUnit (not that many tests, though, about 50), or something else.
>
> Thanks,
> Frank
>
> Frank Enos
> Merkley Newman Harty
> AdArts
